intro: Macleania maldonadensis, commonly known as the Maldonado's macleania, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
